title: With Hasbro heading to Boston, R.I. lawmakers want to scrap the Mr. Potato Head license plates
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News A new bill would end the specialty plates that raise money for the Rhode Island Community Food Bank.
A statue of Mr.
Potato Head greets visitors to the corporate headquarters of toymaker Hasbro Inc.

title: Snow totals: See which Mass. towns got hit hardest this past weekend
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Weather Several places in Massachusetts broke the 7-inch mark.

title: Jaylen Brown scores 32, but Celtics fall to Pistons in potential ECF showdown: 7 takeaways

title: The former waterfront Maine home of Gov. Ken Curtis lists for $4M
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Real Estate It was designed by John Howard Stevens, the son of architect John Calvin Stevens, who was known for creating some of the prominent churches, libraries, and homes in the Portland area.
1 Bay Road, South Portland is on the market.

title: Could a retooling Bruins team be buyers this season? It’s complicated.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins The Bruins' pursuit of Rasmus Andersson signals that Boston might be willing to add talent this season.

title: Drake Maye shares what he knows about new Broncos starting QB Jarrett Stidham
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I wish him the best of luck and looking forward to seeing how he does.
Hopefully we come out with a win.

title: Celtics’ Jaylen Brown earns his first NBA All-Star starter nod
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown is off to one of the best starts of his career and earned another accolade for it.
Jaylen Brown Barry Chin/The Boston Globe Jaylen Brown will be one of five starters for the Eastern Conference in next month’s NBA All-Star game, the league announced Monday.
It will be Brown’s fifth All-Star appearance and first time starting the game.

title: ESPN’s Dan Orlovsky trolls Patriots defense after win over Texans
author: Conor Ryan

J.
